Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2009 10:17PM ryjuem wrote: The beginning of the journey is soo confusing and overwhelming.  I found the surgeon and the oncologist to be abrupt and felt like I was not really included in all the information.  At this point I have had:  lumpectomy (3 tumors, but all in one quadrant so he could do a quandrantectomy--I was large enough so it wasn't all that deforming; just a little lopsided now!)  chemotherapy - July 15 '08 through July 2 '09 radiation- 6+ weeks of daily treatments One thing I learned through it all is that the surgeon was great at doing surgery, the oncologist was great at knowing about cancer.  Neither of them were helpful to me with dealing with the emotional part or with understanding all the new terms. I found it helpful to go to a support group like Gilda's Club or something related just to breast cancer.  Once I knew what questions to ask, the surgeon and oncologist were more helpful to me as a person rather than just a body with abnormal cells!  I still rely on the support group for understanding that cancer isn't just cells, but now a new way to navigate life. Everyone's journey is different...if someone is trying to help but you feel dismissed, go ahead and dismiss them!  It's all about you now.  Every feeling and thought you have is OK...
